bug.short_desc: Cybersecurity Test - adapt blr failed

long_desc.thetext: The test in the cybersecurity test plan where an adapted blr file shall be identified by the software failed.

Every implant CAD file is stored as a simplex model on disc while generating all database files. All models of a single implant system are stored together in one blr resource-file which is distributed by Hip7. For instance there is file called IY_R3_Cups_2121.blr for all CAD files of R3 cups. For loading these implant files at runtime of application the mechanism of ResourceLoader of Reslib is used. As I understand it, first the complete file is opened and only the ids of every resource is identified. On request the necessary single resource is loaded. There are no additional possibilities to check the resources in advance. I assume if you really modify part of resource you will need later one, an error will occur and the loading is stopped. But you cannot know that. If there is really an requirement for security reasons its necessary to assign this bug to Reslib directly. //sw/config/domain/base/11.0/bundle/Bundle_Base/11.0.1/rel.xml#15 On application level I see only one solution: In older applications the software was installed independent of used database. In ordere to check availability of all correct database files, we had implemented only in service mode the functionality, that software is loading all necessary implants of every manufacturer at program start. This takes some time, but this was checked only by service engineer directly after installation. My be such an functionality can be used also for cybersecurity reasons, but * every program start would take some more time ( > 10 sec??? ) * functionality must be re-implemented
please set target milestone and spec after meeting

Since implant data that is stored in .blr-files is only used for displaying a cup on the navigation page and is NOT used for any calculation, a manipulation of a specific .blr-file doesn't result in patient harm performing a workflow provided with HIP7 v7.0. Thus, severity is still trivial. But whenever a later version of HIP7 uses implant data for calculation, severity has to be re-evaluated. --> set target milestone to "7.1.0" Regarding cybersecurity, plausible vulnerabilities in the process of loading .blr-files using Reslib should be evaluated. This was addressed in bug 126967. Encryption of database still need to be tested.
--> set target to "later", as the relevant root bug will only be fixed with framework 13.0.0 that will be released after HIP7 v7.1

bug.short_desc: Cup Impactor Visualization - Product Management Feedback 27th November 2017

long_desc.thetext: On the navigation page it was suggested by PdM that the used cup impactor shall be transparently overlayed above the cup axis. (see ETF "0000100715"). This is a suggestion which will be evaluated.
--> set to later
Only brings value if the actual cup impactor is displayed in its live position and orientation --> no implementation within HIP7v7.1 --> target Later still valid

bug.short_desc: ENHANCEMENT - Pinless - idea how to determine the M/L direction independently from the SMS-reference orientation

long_desc.thetext: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #49464 +++ For pinless a rough registration is needed to show the crosshair movement correctly. Currently this depends on the z-direction of the SMS array. So the SMS array defines the M/L direction in lateral position and the A/P direction in supine position. DOH had the idea to always set the M/L direction using the direction of the pre-op reference point to its projection on the mech axis. Doing so we would become independent from the SMS array orientation.
Information for Hip 7.0
Please decide, if we shall implement it. The idea is really not bad.
DOH often has really good ideas which sometimes are ahead of the times. 8 years in this case. :-)
re-assigned

The described idea for identification of the M/L direction will not be implemented in Hip 7 due to the following reasons: - It is to be expected that the screw might not always be placed in a true lateral position from the center of rotation. In fact the femoral antetorsion is in average 15Â° and might vary by a large amount from patient to patient. Therefore the suggested solution probably does not bring the expected benefit, especially for patients with a large femoral antetorsion. - In addition there is no feedback from the field that this mismatch of the M/L direction lead to the situation that the user was unable to bring the leg back into neutral position.

In Croxley Lab Dec 2020 pinless algorithm in combination with ClearLens technology and a prototype software of Hip7v7.1 was used. Due to visibility issues, especially in lateral patient position, the question raised up if the pinless array can be rotated around femoral bone. If it will be necessary, current proposed idea should be considered again within Hip7v7.1 project.
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to late

bug.short_desc: Stem Size attribute values are handled as pure number format

long_desc.thetext: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #73581 +++ +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #63836 +++ The attribute Stem Size is handled as a numeric value in the software, but in the database it is maintained as text. This may cause unexpected effects when parsing attribute values, that contain characters different from numbers. For future releases a different approach should be chosen to fulfill the two ways the attribute is used at the moment: 1. Finding matching broaches via numeric comparison of attribute values 2. Display stem size label as used by the manufacturer/surgeon.
Check if this problem occurs when database concept for Hip 7.0 was defined. --> set state to confirmed
not relevant for Hip 7.0 requirements, so it will be shifted to 7.1
needs to be considered for new SN database within HIP7v7.1 project
all works fine with refactored database used by HIP7v7.1
stem size attribute can be selected in implant selection menu of HIP7 v7.1 bug fixed.
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to late

bug.short_desc: Implant's size-dependend compatibility issue

long_desc.thetext: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #73797 +++ During special test scenarios we detected possibilities which leads to an incomplete implant selection by changing the implant size. description: selected shell system : sizes ... 46, 44, 42, 40, 38 e.g. Bantam Shells Depuy liner: compatible to selected shell and head, but for size 46 and 44 : compatibiliy to head diameter 28, 26 and 22 size 42, 40, 38 : compatibility only to head diameter 22 correct case: a head system was selected, which exists in the head diameter 28, 26 and 22 ( Articul. heads ). If user starts with (1) shell size 44 and head 28, (2) increase shell size by control to 42 (3) software automatically select a liner for 22 mm heads, automatically change the visible attribute of selected head system to 22 and select a compatible head --> all is correct incorrect case: A head system was selected, which exists only with the head diameter 28 and 26 ( BILOX heads ). If user starts with (1) shell size 44 and head 28, (2) increase shell size by control to 42 (3) software automatically select a liner for 22 mm heads, but for this liner no head is compatible. This combination does not exist and the user needs to switch the head system. No valid implant selection exists. The software detects that no compatible head exist. On the implant selection page the complete row will be disabled. The RESET button is disabled, because no valid implant selection exists, the NEXT button is disabled because currently not all implant parts are selected. The user has to know some details to solve this issue. In such a case the software should not disable the complete row of the implant part but enable the switch to another implant system ( in this case from BILOX heads to articuleze heads ).
Check if this problem occurs when database concept for Hip 7.0 was defined. --> set state to confirmed
set the milestone to Hip 7.1 as within 7.0 only a pelvis part ( liner / shell ) implant selection is used without a manual implant selection user interface

* Refer to Xtool Target: Ta.3GEH6G * Implant selection for S+N implant systems needs to be user friendly target 7.1.0 is still valid, but bug issue needs to be adapted to content of database used with HIP7v7.1

There are implant combinations which are not compatible, its true. But the current implant selection is designed in a way that the user is informed always if all fits together. The current implementation should be tested carefully also regarding usability and user-friendliness.
Implant selection was implemented as specified and underwent exploratory testing --> set status to "Resolved -> fixed"
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Use anatomical symbols instead of "P"/ "F" for visibility indicators

long_desc.thetext: The visibility of the tracking array that is mounted on the pelvis (femur) is indicated by a specific color-coding of the symbol "P" ("F"). These symbols don't correlate with the symbols that are shown on the respective ClearLens instruments. Using anatomical symbols (pelvis, femur) instead of "P"/ "F", the user might even more clearly match the symbols to the respective tracking array.
--> set bug to confirmed and target milestone to 7.1.0
accepted current target for HIP7v7.1 project --> changing symbols in software from ‘P’/’F’ to anatomical symbols
use new icons with anatomical symbols
Changes were implemented according to specifications. "P" and "F" were replaced by anatomical symbols --> set status to "resolved - fixed"
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to late

bug.short_desc: WPF on-screen keyboard not available in Japanese

long_desc.thetext: Hip 7.0 Software localization requested by S&N: DE, FR, JP The Brainlab WPF on-screen keyboard that is provided by Usability (MLL) is available in the following languages: de-de en-us en-gb es fr it (Info of MLL of 12 Sep 2019) For Japanese, the Brainlab WPF on-screen keyboard is not available. As a workaround, the Windows on-screen keyboard could be displayed to the user. For the Windows on-screen keyboard, Japanese is available.

According to usability requirements, the WPF on-screen keyboard needs to be used. Thus, WPF on-screen keyboard shall NOT be exchanged by windows on-screen keyboard (JP) to provide a HIP7 specific solution with regard to the GUI language JP. Much more, since the WPF on-screen keyboard is also used by other applications, the missing WPF keyboard in JP is more an issue in general. Therefore, this bug will be closed (Resolved - Wontfix). A new bug 128243 was opened (R&D common -> domain/ gui -> plugin/wpf/wpftouchkeyboard) to request the WPF on-screen keyboard in JP.
--> set to closed-wontfix

The WPF on-screen keyboard is used to enter the ASIS-ASIS distance on the settings page of HIP7. The appropriate value needs to be entered using numbers. Due to the international networking of the user, Arabic numerals are usually known. Although a keyboard is not available in Japanese, an key in English is displayed. With this in mind, severity was set to "minor". *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 128243 ***
As Hip 7.0.0 software is released now this bug will be closed.

As disscussed we Uta, any translation issues at brainlab will get a minor importance. This leads to a situation that the normal LOKA ( list-of-known-anomalies ) process does not fit. Here only bugzilla-entries with an importance "normal" or higher will be reported. So its necessary again to handle an open bug by every application till issue at framework module is fixed.
Set target to later as issue needs to be fixed within underlaying wpf bundle
--> set status to "resolved - wontfix" as the bug 120243 associated with that bug also won't be fixed

bug.short_desc: Language problem in one English string

long_desc.thetext: Hip7 7.0.0 "hipres_text_alert_invalidPelvicTilt_message": The software calculated a pelvic tilt outside the accepted range of +-22°. Use different plan or continue navigation without automatic pelvic tilt and ASIS-ASIS distance calculation. Found during testing of the Japanese version: “+-“ is very uncommon, it should be “±” I double-checked with ATA, and +- is not great, but the users will understand it. ± is better. Since I am not sure of the software can display ± correctly and if it will be legible, I suggest to rephrase to: (...)outside the accpeted range of +22° and -22°
as the signs are not unambiguous to a user I would prefer to use anatomical synonyms like (...)outside the accepted range of 22° anterior or posterior tilt.
Needs to be tested.

Use different plan or continue navigation without pelvic tilt and ASIS-ASIS distance calculation.

long_desc.thetext: Hip7, file provided for localization (//data/localization/surgery/_transfer/hip/7.0.0/Hip_en.blr@1559710): In the following two strings, the second sentence "Press..." starts with a superfluous white space. bug.short_desc: Localization: strings not captured for localization in Hip 7.0

long_desc.thetext: Strings of an alert message in the Hip7 7.0 have not been captured for localization. See attached screenshot.
Created attachment 41015 Alert message not translated- strings not captured

--> set status to "confirmed", version to "7.0.0 RC3" and severity to "minor" This bug applies to Re-Registration and TraumaCad Import Alerts. Both alert groups are not assessed to be a risk mitigating measure. Moreover, even if the user doesn't understand meaning of alerts belonging to these alert groups, the patient will not be exposed to a risk caused by that misunderstanding. Thus, severity was set to "minor". The missing alert groups were captured via screenshots. The screenshots are stored in Perforce //data/localization/surgery/_transfer/hip/7.0.0/. The revision number is 1616734. The localization transfer statement Hip7 (Windchill ID: 0000204231) needs to be changed in a later version of HIP7 v7.0. The alerts need to be considered in all approved and running GUI translations of HIP7 (GUI REV 1.0 HIP 7.0 DE/FR/JP, 60713-70DE/FR/JP). Thus, target milestone was set to "7.0.0 RC4". Bug was reassigned to localization team (Uta Kreimeier).
HIP 7.0 DE is already released, and JP/FR are at proofreading stage. We localize the version that corresponds to the Localization Transfer Statement.
Groups will be broken up and a screenshot will be captured for all warnings --> set target HIP7 v7.1
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to late

attachment.desc: Alert message not translated- strings not captured

bug.short_desc: Hip 7 doesn't show bone model with DX11-Error

long_desc.thetext: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #139029 +++ Hip 7 doesnt show bone models, logfiles sho DX11 error messsages: [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.589][Platform][5528] DX11-Error : D3DCompile(shader0, strlen((const char *)shader0), nullptr, nullptr, nullptr, "main_technique", "fx_5_0", 0x0/*shaderFlags*/, 0/*effectFlags*/, &ID3DBlob_0x0000000000000000, &compilerMessages0); : 0x80004005 (Unspecified failure.) [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.590][Paint3D][5528] DX11 effect compiler error F:\Brainlab\appls\Hip_7.0.0\hip\<'memory>(1,1): error X3000: Illegal character in shader file [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.597][Paint3D][5528] RealizeFailed -- DX11 Effect could not be created ! -> No StageRealizer could handle this RasterizationPrograms stage program ! -> Failed to render this SimplexModel component as "SimplexModel" ! -> Failed to render this Quad component as "Quad" ! -> Failed to render this PaintContext3D component as "Container" ! -> paintdx11::PaintContextDX11::renderAdditional() failed ! [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.651][Paint3D][5528] RealizeFailed -- DX11 Effect could not be created ! -> No StageRealizer could handle this RasterizationPrograms stage program ! -> Failed to render this SimplexModel component as "SimplexModel" ! -> Failed to render this Quad component as "Quad" ! -> Failed to render this PaintContext3D component as "Container" ! -> paintdx11::PaintContextDX11::renderAdditional() failed ! deleting the DX11 cache (C:\ProgramData\Brainlab\Cache) seems to have resolved it at least in one instance
is fixed with Framework 12.0.1 --> hip7 v7.0 uses framework 11

The bug was evaluated by the project team from a risk perspective. One can conclude the following: In case 3D views are not displayed on the navigation page as a consequence of the bug happening, the effectiveness of risk mitigating measures linked to the risk cause Cs.38XPQH is slightly reduced. Displaying 3D hip views is one measure out of several. The correct implementation is proven by performed verification tests. With this in mind and as the bug occurs very rarely, the risk rating after measure is still valid. Does the bug result in a new risk? The presentation of the morphed hip bone serves as a visual support for the surgeon to recognize the reference planes. Calculations are independent from the displayed bone model. Thus, if the hip model is not shown, the surgeon might switch to conventional surgery as the software obviously run into an error. An experienced user who knows well the position of Inc./ Ant. values referring to either the AP-plane or functional plane can still rely on calculated values as the calculation is independent of the visualization. Consequentially, the occurrence of the bug doesn't expose the patient to a risk. The importance of the bug was derated to "minor". Following the strategy to only fix bugs which potentially expose the patient to a risk, this bug will not be fixed within the project SNNA030 HIP7 v7.0.x MDR and is set to "later".

bug.short_desc: Missing plausibility check if user selected wrong treatment side

long_desc.thetext: According to feedback of Prof. Davis, HIP7v7.0 does not give a warning message if acquired landmarks of pelvis registration does to fit to selected treatment side. In HIP6 their was a plausibility check for "peak of Psoas Valley" landmark. Here two possible sources of error were possible (1) peak of Psoas Valley was acquired posterior instead of anterior (2) wrong treatment side In HIP7 this landmark was removed and the radius of acetabular sphere used instead. So probably this treatment side check does not exist anymore. It needs to be evaluated how to check the correct treatment side for a) lateral cased b) supine cases
added cc list
added franzi on cc

Idea from MO: add a plausibility check that checks in comparison to the plane defined by ASIS-ASIS and acetabular center the position of the registered cavity points. On average 83.3% are posterior to that plane In worst case 58% are posterior to that plane A plausibility check can be defined after pelvis registration that checks the position of the cavity points. If 50% are anterior to the plane a warning can be given out. Decision on what the user can do than is pending: a) re-register cavity b) check and adapt treatment side c) ignore and continue
Created attachment 50040 error message dialog

implemented as a proposal to offer a) re-register cavity b) check and adapt treatment side Option c) is currently not offered. Please verify if this add. plausibility check shall be used and if the error message is correct. At the moment in lateral cases a different plausibility check is triggered prior to this later check, this needs to be evaluated.

Comment on attachment 50040 error message dialog I think we could simplify the text. Something like "The registration of the acetabulum is not compatible with the selected treated side. Please correct the selected treated side or re-register the cavity points" This aside, I think it is "treated side" in the button, right?
You can specify how to name the button. The text should not be too long as otherwise the text size will be reduced.
Specifications concerning PC mentioned in this bug need to be reviewed and updated if needed.
specification updated and added in xtool

long_desc.thetext: An automatic landmark detection or atlas for landmark registration in Traumacad could support the user during planning. Spine team is working on that (contact partner: SGN)
As this is more a feature request on Traumacad side, we decided to do no implementation within Hip7v7.1 project. I will set target of this enhancement bug to "later"

long_desc.thetext: To adapt the range for plausibility checks it could help to have patient specific plausibility checks in terms of gender, weight, height. Here a database like ANSUR II might be helpful. bug.short_desc: Adaption of navigation page to avoid misinterpetration of cup position as depth

long_desc.thetext: The current presentation of the cup navigation can lead to a misinterpretation of the cup position as depth information of the current cup position and should therefore be adapted
* Refer to Xtool Requirement: Rq.357R77 * Analyse during usability tests * Set to Target: 7.1
Please consider this bug developing features from usabiliy/ UI-design perspective.
for navigation on a AP-X-ray: we decided to use only the original X-ray without showing any template information
Solution as suggested was implemented. -> set status to "implemented"

bug.short_desc: Adjust acetabular registration (according to size)

long_desc.thetext: Acetabular registration should be adapted to match the cavity size or the templated size. Since in small cavities it is hard to acquire the required amount of points. A bigger size should be equivalent to registering more points, while in small sizes the necessary points can be reduced.
We agreed to implement this enhancement within running project of HIP7v7.1
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Integration of the teardrop distance in software

long_desc.thetext: Concerns from Prof. Davis regarding the that the pelvis might have a different shape when the ASIS distnace is below 200mm or above 260mm might have an influence on the software. MO: agreed that the teardrop distance which is currently implemented as a constant in the software depending on the gender could also be used in the software with the actual values from the x-ray.

Lateral cases with postoperative CT data are only available from Birmingham study. With these data this concern is not evident. We agreed that its necessary to gather further data to evaluate this issue. This will be considered in PMS of HIP7v7.1. So no implementation will be done for HIP7v7.1 and the target of this bug will be set to "later".

bug.short_desc: Store bar keeps running when offset or leg length values change

long_desc.thetext: The store bar keeps running when the leg is moved and offset and leg length values change. The plausibility check here works in principal but is not restrictive enough.
Analyzed bug.

long_desc.thetext: Plausibility check on surgery setup page strongly relays on correct orientation of femur array. If the two spheres face towards the pelvis array, the message of placing the femur array more distally disappears a lot sooner than when the array is oriented as intended. This may need to be considered in RA at a later point
Bug was analyzed.

bug.short_desc: Plausibility check based on distance CoR to midplane needs to be re-evaluated

long_desc.thetext: This check is based on a acetabular distance ( teardrop distance + radius of acetabular sphere ). Sometimes this check brings false positive results and prompt user to repeat registration. Especially in connection to wrong selected treatment side this check needs to be re-evaluated.
Specifications need to be reviewed and updated where needed. Also mentioned in bug
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Reset pivoting point aquisition accuracy

long_desc.thetext: Reset the pivoting values to the values specified in Sp.38DPCK (When the software detects that the pointer is rotated around the point of interest, then the point will be stored. The software detects the movements as deliberated pivoting when the pointer tip does not move more than 1 mm and another detected point (handle point) with the distance of 400mm from the tip is moving at least 20 mm in 20 frames.) New points such as ankle and epicondyles require testing in cadaver lab or suitable test object to define pivoting
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Minimal pineless array distance

long_desc.thetext: BVO: Pinless array position: we’ve had feedback (e.g. from Ed Davis) that 400mm min distance is too large in some patients. So we should discuss whether we should reduce it. After checking the ANSUR II Database a reduction to 300mm shall be implemented.
will be changed in version 7.1.0.928

Perforce change 1954875 by mario.schubert on Tue Apr 13 10:00:43 +0200 2021 BUGFIX: change minimal distance between pelvic array ( rotational joint of array ) and femur array from 400mm to 300mm Affected files: //sw/dev/ortho/mario.schubert/Hip7x_trunc/plugin/igs/ortho/hip/hipregcalculations/src/StatisticalAnatomicConstants.cpp#4 edit
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Implant selection to choose compatible implant components

long_desc.thetext: Rather than showing in the implant component fields 'Please select compatible implant...' show that as a global note since the user does not necessarily need to change the component where this message appears
addressed by current usability concept
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Component index for implant sorting in SW

long_desc.thetext: An additional component index needs to be introduced to sort shells accordingly: 01 = 0 Deg 02 = 0Deg +4 03 = 20 deg ... Also stems should have an additional component index for sorting in SW 01 = standard 02 = lateral ...
liners not shells need the additional ordering attribute
A new ordering attribute / component index was created for all liners (ordering attribute 3) A new ordering attribute / component index was created for all stems (ordering attribute 2)
Change implemented as specified. Exploratory testing was passed. --> set status to "resolved - fixed"
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Procedure overview page implant selection shifted arrows and boxes

long_desc.thetext: In the implant selection on the procedure overview page the boxes containing the implants (size, type, etc.) that appear when clicking on the arrows are shifted to the left. And the arrows do not always point to the selected implant component parameter. As introduced in bug #141756 the writing that appears when no compatible implant component is selected shall appear in white and the box shall have a red bounding.
text messages and red borders are implemented; see Build 922 location of popup windows are in progress ...
needs to be checked vy usability
*** Bug 142331 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
verify with Build 950. Arrows removed
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Layout of implant selection for no compatible implant

long_desc.thetext: On the PO page and other pages where the user shall select an implant, if no compatible implant component is selected the text 'please select compatible implant component' shall be displayed in white and a red box shall surround the text. The next button shall be disabled until a fitting implant combination is selected If the user selects an implant component during the workflow to which his other component is not compatible the user shall be prompted to the implant selection and select a compatible implant system, only then he can proceed in the workflow. (for example: on the stem verification page the user selects a 32 head size, but he selected a OR3O liner system on the procedure overview page. He should be directed to the implant selection and select compatible components.) (maybe the liner selection in terms of liner system needs to be changeable even after the Procedure overview page (here I am not sure))

Changes were implemented according to current specifications. Minor changes might be required based on surgeon feedback during formative usability testing/ lab testing. --> set status to "implemented"
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Ensure selection of right shell size on COR-shift prediction page

long_desc.thetext: On the COR-shift prediction page it needs to be ensured that the correct size of the shell that is implanted is selected before selecting a liner. This is a usability topic.
COR-shift functionality was removed from cup-verification page. Additionally the functionality to offer the possibility to select correct implant selection was added.
--> set target to "later" as the COR-prediction feature was excluded from HIP7 v7.1

bug.short_desc: R3 shells selection requires shell type

long_desc.thetext: R3 shells need to have the shell type (no hole, three hole, multi hole) as an additional attribute in the implant selection. The shell type was set as an visible attribute in the DB. The shell type should be selectable until the cup is finally implanted
implement within Build 922; how to fix visible attributes after final implantation should be discussed after prototype is tested
Exploratory testing was passed. --> set status to "resolved - fixed"
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Shaking bones with ClearLens within navigation page on Curve Navigation platform

long_desc.thetext: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #139737 +++ Platform: Curve Navigation (M-Platform) Instruments: ClearLens Software: Knee3 v3.3.0.281 (RC1) When using ClearLens on the navigation page the bones are "shaking" and values are jumping. More blue points on the ROM graph as usually. So far only seen on Curve Navigation (M-Platform) to this extend. Not seen with metal / DRMS instruments. Reproducible also with Knee 3.2.2 and Knee 3.3 prototype.

-> status was set to "confirmed" under reserve Released hip application are not designed for use with ClearLens arrays. Thus, there is not an urgent need for further investigation at present. But HIP7 v7.1 shall be compatible with instruments being equipped with ClearLens Markers. The reported issue will be analyzed during the HIP7 v7.1 project also considering the final list of compatible BL platforms. Curve Navigation might not be on that list.
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Import data from Hip3D planning

long_desc.thetext: Probably a 3D hip planning project will be running parallel to Hip7v7.1 project. If so it would be really helpful to import single planned values into navigation software, e.g. * measured asis-asis distance * measured teardrop distance * pelvic tilt * native antetorsion * implant selection * ... Please consider prior to G3(feature freeze, currently planned for July 2021 ) if such an import can be established within Hip7v7.1 project.
As HIP3DProject is not started yet, we decided to change target from 7.1.0 to Later

bug.short_desc: Hip 7 doesn't show bone model with DX11-Error

long_desc.thetext: Hip 7 doesnt show bone models, logfiles sho DX11 error messsages: [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.589][Platform][5528] DX11-Error : D3DCompile(shader0, strlen((const char *)shader0), nullptr, nullptr, nullptr, "main_technique", "fx_5_0", 0x0/*shaderFlags*/, 0/*effectFlags*/, &ID3DBlob_0x0000000000000000, &compilerMessages0); : 0x80004005 (Unspecified failure.) [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.590][Paint3D][5528] DX11 effect compiler error F:\Brainlab\appls\Hip_7.0.0\hip\(1,1): error X3000: Illegal character in shader file [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.597][Paint3D][5528] RealizeFailed -- DX11 Effect could not be created ! -> No StageRealizer could handle this RasterizationPrograms stage program ! -> Failed to render this SimplexModel component as "SimplexModel" ! -> Failed to render this Quad component as "Quad" ! -> Failed to render this PaintContext3D component as "Container" ! -> paintdx11::PaintContextDX11::renderAdditional() failed ! [14-Oct-2020 12:53:38.651][Paint3D][5528] RealizeFailed -- DX11 Effect could not be created ! -> No StageRealizer could handle this RasterizationPrograms stage program ! -> Failed to render this SimplexModel component as "SimplexModel" ! -> Failed to render this Quad component as "Quad" ! -> Failed to render this PaintContext3D component as "Container" ! -> paintdx11::PaintContextDX11::renderAdditional() failed ! deleting the DX11 cache (C:\ProgramData\Brainlab\Cache) seems to have resolved it at least in one instance
Created attachment 45854 Case-20201013-367799
Created attachment 45855 Case-20201030-369901
This bug is now referenced in CID Comp-20201030-076746. See https://eu1.salesforce.com/5001i00000ULpdNAAT
seem that this issue also occurred with other applications and is now fixed at plugin/common/paintdx11 see bugzilla 140122 --> necessary to use latest patch of paintdx11 for HiIP7v7.1
needs to be tested ( however its possible to provoke that's issue ) Current prototype is based on released framework 12.x, so this issue should be solved.
set correct severity

As this error only very rarely occurs, the bug fix cannot reasonably be tested. Needs to be observed during verification testing of HIP7 v7.1. If the problem doesn't happen again, the bug will be set to "Closed - fixed" For now, status is set to "Resolved - Fixed"

bug.short_desc: [AppManagement] Rotating wheel shown in CM after patient change and HIP navi is included in the wfl

long_desc.thetext: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #138954 +++ TESTING ENVIRONMENT: AxedaDesktopServer - 6.8.209.3 BackboneApplication RELEASE 1.6.1.38 BackboneViewer RELEASE 1.6.1.574 BrainlabTrackingService RELEASE 4.1.0.9 Camera RELEASE 2.0.0.103 CaseReport RELEASE 2.2.1.78 Clock - 1.0.2.62 ContentManager RELEASE 2.7.0.499 Cranial Navigation RELEASE 4.0.0.159 Cranial Registration RELEASE 3.5.1.247 CranialENT RELEASE 3.1.5.177 DataSelection RELEASE 6.1.0.232 DICOMProxy RELEASE 4.1.5.552 Hip RELEASE 7.0.0.906 IGSDataRecorder RELEASE 1.0.0.14 ImageFusion RELEASE 4.0.2.8 ImageFusionPerformer RELEASE 5.0.0.72 ImageSortingPerformer RELEASE 1.2.0.30 ImageViewer RELEASE 5.1.1.98 MorphisServer RELEASE 2.0.1.8 NodeMaster RELEASE 1.6.0.48 ObjectManagement RELEASE 1.1.1.8 OpticalMarkerArrays - 1.0.2.3 PatientDataManager - 2.7.0.499 PatientSelection RELEASE 6.1.0.198 SettingsManager - 1.0.0.155 Spine & Trauma Instrument Selection RELEASE 1.5.1.496 SpineTrauma_Instruments+Sets - 1.0.0.115.2 SQLLocalDB - 11.2.5058.19 StreamingProvider RELEASE 2.0.2.32 StreamingServer RELEASE 2.0.0.14 UATransferPerformer RELEASE 5.0.0.72 UniversalAtlasPerformer RELEASE 5.0.0.72 VegaIPService RELEASE 4.1.0.9 XBrainConverter RELEASE 2.3.0.20 Zeroconf BETA 1.0.0.4 DEWPQAKICK04 Kick2.0 STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1. Create or choose patient 2. Open HIP7 3. Select TraumaCAD Plan and go to registration 4. Press HOME Button in upper right corner EXPECTED RESULT: Content Manager should be shown ACTUAL RESULT: Spinning wheel is shown in Content manager and Content manager cannot be used unit I close HIP application with F4. Within the software it shall always be possible to switch between metal and ClearLens. ClearLens shall be set as default instrument type.
implemented with Knee3.3 development

bug.short_desc: unable to switch to x-ray free navigation when plausibility check rejects x-ray

long_desc.thetext: when an x-ray based workflow is started, and during registration the x-ray is rejected due to plausability checks, it's impossible to bail out to a non x-ray based cup navigation and surgeon is left with only leg length/offset maesurement
see Case-20200819-361582 as related (entered by Mario based on the original email from Charlie)
This bug is now referenced in CID Comp-20200828-075248. See https://eu1.salesforce.com/5001i00000RxbgCAAR

If X-ray data itself will trigger a plausibility check, the planning data will be rejected and not used for navigation. This issue is clear and already implemented. In current case * the X-ray data are consistent ( or at least will not trigger a plausibility check ) * the registration data are consistent ( or at least will not trigger a plausibility check ) but both data will not fit together. In such an case the software cannot find out the source of an error. This additional plausibility check was intentional implemented in order to prevent an incorrect cup navigation. Current issue should be handled with care.
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: add "FeePerUse - OneUsageDetected" to SUS logfile

long_desc.thetext: please add Category FeePerUse Feature OneUsageDetected whenever during a workflow its clear that the software has been actually used (depending on workflow) not just accidentally started. should be written at most once per procedure.
ps note that SUS does not list any Hip 7 data yet so I was unable to verify if this has already been added. We might want to upload SUS data from our marketing KICK to start seeing that data

should already be implemented in Hip7v7.0 according to default JR implementation: CupAndLeg workflow: * on cup navigation page * on pinless legsituation page Express workflow * on pinless legsituation page
* should be implemented for new workflows * refer to Xtool Requirement: Rq.357RGG
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Acetabular registration visualization not helpful

long_desc.thetext: there are numerous reports from the field that the current visualization of the acetabular registration points (first, one circel, then three sectors) is not helping to understand where and if points are missing. From: Thombs, Charlie [mailto:Charlie.Thombs@smith-nephew.com] Sent: Tuesday, January 28, 2020 12:32 AM To: Martin Bauer Cc: Langlois, Xavier ; Belmore, Jenna ; Mackey, Marc Subject: Acetabular registration Martin, I wanted to get back with you regarding acetabular registration with HIP7 based on your recommendations. So for the lab that we did last week and the demos we ran on the DEMO acetabulum, we utilized the concentric circles and it worked great! In addition, we also had the surgeon focus on the native acetabulum and not so much on the screen which also seemed to help. So all in all, these 2 tips greatly improved the workflow. Best Regards, Charlie Charlie Thombs | Global Marketing Robotics and Surgical Technologies Charlie.thombs@smith-nephew.com Mobile: +1.414.628.4901 www.smith-nephew.com

Proposal of usability is implemented and need to be tested. No one segment representation anymore, always three segments will be show. At beginning all segments are filled/cleared identically but with a reduced percentage. If enough cavity points are available to calculate a raw center-of-rotation, the percentage of every segment is updated.
Hip 7.1 refers to project Hyperion (SNNA06) which was cancelled; and not to the project HIP7 v7.1 for MDR release of HIP7 (SNNA030). --> changed target to later

bug.short_desc: Verification Workflow - Plausibility Check Cup Inserter Movement

long_desc.thetext: GUI change required: When a movement of the cup inserter is detected after verification the Inclination and Anteversion values need to disappear.

This bug refers to previously documented risk cause Cause Cs.3922KT and its appropriate control measure Sp.397TFM. Fixing this bug is absolutely necessary until the workflow Cup Verification shall be released. As the workflow Cup Verification was excluded from release scope of HIP7 v7.0.0, target milestone is set to later.

bug.short_desc: Verification Workflow - Plausibility Checks

long_desc.thetext: The plausibility checks during and after pelvis registration need to be updated. Compare with plausibility checks in Cup and Leg workflow.
it was decided to exclude these tasks from scope of Hip 7.0.0 as this workflow will not be released So I will set the milestone to later

bug.short_desc: Verification Workflow - ASIS treated picture

long_desc.thetext: The ASIS treated picture needs to be adapted in such a way that the ASIS landmark is better visible (compare ASIS picture in Cup and Leg workflow).
--> set to confirmed Since release of the workflow Cup Verification was excluded from release scope HIP7 v7.0.0, target milestone is set to "later". Fixing this bug provides a more intuitive GUI.

bug.short_desc: History of verified leg length and offset values

long_desc.thetext: Product management wants to include a feature which shows the history of the performed leg length and offset measurements.
set correct milestone to later
Implementation of predictive trialing offers user a prediction of LL & OS therefore a history of prior measurements does not offer additional value --> so target "later" is still valid

bug.short_desc: XTool Pro documentation updates

long_desc.thetext: Documentation errors were noticed during RC 1 testing which shall be changed in the specifications and tests at a later point: Te.38ZN5X: format of date of manufacture needs to be YYYY-MM-DD and it should say Customer support Number --> see also bug: 153660 In general specifications as in bug 153662 need to be adapted Te.3943XA, Te.3943U7, Te.3932R2, Te.3932MW, Te.3932PY, Te.3932NX, Te.3932QZ, Te.3932S3, Te.3943V8, Te.3943W9, Te.39444G, Te.39446J, Te.39447K, Te.3944BP, Te.3944P3: formulation unclear: domain cannot be selected but needs to be searched for. Te.3BN4JJ: Cup impactor Depuy Straight should be named Pinnacle Straight Te.3944HV: Header should say second rim point. Entry shall say ThisRegistrationPage / Pelvis_OpposingAcetabularRim. Test is wrongly linked in XTool it is currently linked to Sp.38EGRS but shall be linked to Sp.3BS5MS Te.39657N, Te.3L3DRQ: Tests shall ensure that considering the minimum rule for the listed applications and versions, all listed applications regardless of the version is installed.
--> set to confirmed after documentation bugs were noticed during testing

Te.3943XA, Te.3943U7, Te.3932R2, Te.3932MW, Te.3932PY, Te.3932NX, Te.3932QZ, Te.3932S3, Te.3943V8, Te.3943W9, Te.39444G, Te.39446J, Te.39447K, Te.3944BP, Te.3944P3: formulation unclear: domain cannot be selected but needs to be searched for. --> domain can be searched by click on calculate domains

bug.short_desc: Intended use of SOUPs shall be specified in SW requirements documentation

Set target to later as the documentation is already in a release state. In the Qualification of SOUP Template a reference to this bug is done see Windchill: - 0000008624, SOUP - Qualification of Software of Unknown Provenance FTDI Library 2.8.14 (see also bug 141622 for KNEE3) and - 0000309988, SOUP Microsoft Expression Blend SDK HIP7
Version 7.1.0 RC1 already refers to project SNNA030 for release of HIP7 under MDR which was later changed to a second digit change --> HIP7 v7.1

bug.short_desc: Bip package wrong version

long_desc.thetext: In the following specifications the names, versions and rules are defined. Sp.3BHARS Sp.3BHAST Sp.3BWN93 In Sp.3BHARS the rule convention for the Cup and Leg and express workflow are set wrongly instead of - "Workflow-HIP7CupAndLeg" minVersion="7.1.0" - "Workflow-HIP7ExpressLeg" minVersion="7.1.0" It should be: - "Workflow-HIP7CupAndLeg" minVersion="7.0.0" - "Workflow-HIP7ExpressLeg" minVersion="7.0.0" In Sp.3BHAST, Sp.3BWN93 the version is set wrongly instead of: - - it should be: - - because the bip packages of the Cup and Leg and Express Leg workflow were not changed. Implementation is correct. no tests are affected
additional wrong version in folllowing specs Sp.3BWNA4/ Sp.3BWN82 similar as in: Sp.3BHAST & Sp.3BWN93/
Version 7.1.0 RC1 already refers to project SNNA030 for release of HIP7 under MDR which was later changed to a second digit change --> HIP7 v7.1
